1.text: I made a covenant with mine eyes; and how should I fix my regard upon a maid?

2.text: For what would have been [my] portion of +God from above, and what the heritage of the Almighty from on high?

3.text: Is not calamity for the unrighteous? and misfortune for the workers of iniquity?

4.text: Doth not he see my ways, and number all my steps?

5.text: If I have walked with falsehood, and my foot hath hasted to deceit,

6.text: (Let me be weighed in an even balance, and +God will take knowledge of my blamelessness;)

7.text: If my step have turned out of the way, and my heart followed mine eyes, and if any blot cleaveth to my hands;

8.text: Let me sow, and another eat; and let mine offspring be rooted out.

9.text: If my heart have been enticed unto a woman, so that I laid wait at my neighbour’s door,

10.text: Let my wife grind for another, and let others bow down upon her.

11.text: For this is an infamy; yea, it is an iniquity [to be judged by] the judges:

12.text: For it is a fire that consumeth to destruction, and would root out all mine increase.

13.text: If I have despised the cause of my bondman or of my bondmaid, when they contended with me,

14.text: What then should I do when God riseth up? and if he visited, what should I answer him?

15.text: Did not he that made me in the womb make him? and did not One fashion us in the womb?

16.text: If I have withheld the poor from [their] desire, or caused the eyes of the widow to fail;

17.text: Or have eaten my morsel alone, so that the fatherless ate not thereof,

18.text: (For from my youth he grew up with me as with a father, and I have guided the [widow] from my mother’s womb;)

19.text: If I have seen any perishing for want of clothing, or any needy without covering;

20.text: If his loins have not blessed me, and if he were not warmed with the fleece of my lambs;

21.text: If I have lifted up my hand against an orphan, because I saw my help in the gate:

22.text: [Then] let my shoulder fall from the shoulder-blade, and mine arm be broken from the bone!

23.text: For calamity from God was a terror to me, and by reason of his excellency I was powerless.

24.text: If I have made gold my hope, or said to the fine gold, My confidence!

25.text: If I rejoiced because my wealth was great, and because my hand had gotten much;

26.text: If I beheld the sun when it shone, or the moon walking in brightness,

27.text: And my heart have been secretly enticed, so that my mouth kissed my hand:

28.text: This also would be an iniquity for the judge, for I should have denied the God who is above.

29.text: If I rejoiced at the destruction of him that hated me, and exulted when evil befell him;

30.text: (Neither have I suffered my mouth to sin by asking his life with a curse;)

31.text: If the men of my tent said not, Who shall find one that hath not been satisfied with his meat?—

32.text: The stranger did not lodge without; I opened my doors to the pathway.

33.text: If I covered my transgressions as Adam, by hiding mine iniquity in my bosom,

34.text: Because I feared the great multitude, and the contempt of families terrified me, so that I kept silence, and went not out of the door,...

35.text: Oh that I had one to hear me! Behold my signature: let the Almighty answer me! And let mine opponent write an accusation!

36.text: Would I not take it upon my shoulder? I would bind it on to me [as] a crown;

37.text: I would declare unto him the number of my steps; as a prince would I come near to him.

38.text: If my land cry out against me, and its furrows weep together;

39.text: If I have eaten the fruits thereof without money, and have tormented to death the souls of its owners:

40.text: Let thistles grow instead of wheat, and tares instead of barley. The words of Job are ended.
